title: if all peers get disconnected, attempt to reconnect to bootnodes

labels.name: non mainnet (private networks)
labels.description: not related to mainnet features - covers privacy, permissioning, IBFT2, QBFT

body:
Currently no attempt is made to reconnect to bootnodes. This can leave besu with 0 peers for some time.

PeerDiscoveryController.refreshPeerTable() is called periodically but we only try to attempt to connect to bootnodes at startup

It turns out static nodes and bootnodes are only treated the same at startup (ie besu tries to connect to them all). However then besu regularly attempts to reconnect to a list of "maintained peers" if besu has fewer than configured max peers. However only static nodes (and enodes added via admin_addPeer) are included in "maintained peers", not bootnodes. This explains why besu does not attempt to reconnect once peers are lost (relies on discovery).

So the answer here is to configure static-nodes if this functionality is required.
